title: MATERIALIZED_VIEW_REFRESH_HISTORY view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Materialized views require Enterprise Edition (or higher). To inquire about upgrading, please contact Snowflake Support.

The MATERIALIZED_VIEW_REFRESH_HISTORY view in the ORGANIZATION_USAGE
schema is used for querying the
materialized views refresh history for
a specified materialized view within a specified date range. The information
returned by the function includes the view name and credits consumed each time
a materialized view is refreshed.
Name of the organization where the usage took place.
Name of the account where the usage took place.
Name of the region where the account is located.
Date (in the UTC time zone) of this refresh history record.
Number of credits billed for materialized view maintenance during the USAGE_DATE.
Internal/system-generated identifier for the materialized view.
Internal/system-generated identifier for the schema that contains the materialized view.
Name of the schema that contains the materialized view.
Internal/system-generated identifier for the database that contains the materialized view.
Name of the database that contains the materialized view.
Latency for the view may be up to 24 hours (1 day).
The data is retained for 365 days (1 year).
